intro: Hieracium canostriatum, commonly known as the red-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, reddish-green leaves and its showy yellow flowers with dark central markings. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows and along stream banks. The plant is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
